result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Gregory A Washington appeared in court, Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared in court for Gregory A Washington. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant is waiting for an attorney to be appointed by SPD. Cannot set a preliminary hearing until the defendant has counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits. If Deft does not have an attorney at the next appearance they can request a contested hearing.
Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Gregory A Washington appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Gregory A Washington. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
